element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm calculates a channel network from a DEM, using a geostatistical approach. Instead of using a single DEM, it generates a set of them from a point layer using kriging and error propagation techniques (each DEM is a simulation). Then it calculates the channel network for each of them and adds all the resulting layers. The values in the output layer represent the probability of each cell of having a channel network flowing through it.
Since this algorithm uses kriging and channel network calculation, it is recommended to check the help files associated to those algorithms.

element.name: SIMULATIONSCOUNT
element.text: The number of DEMs to calculate from the points layer

element.name: LAYER
element.text: The input points layer, with elevation values

element.name: MINPOINTS
element.text: The minimum number of point to perform kriging

element.name: MAXPOINTS
element.text: The maximum number of point to perform kriging

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The threshold for channel network definition

element.name: THRESHOLD
element.text: The criteria for channel network definition

element.name: RESULTCHAN
element.text: The final raster layer with channel network probability. The value in each cell represents the number of simulations for which the corresponding channel network includes that cell.
